sense.name: a blow with the foot
sense.examples: He got a concussion from a kick in the head from a horse. The soccer player gave the ball a tremendous kick that sent it past the goalie. The showgirls lined up in a row and began their famous kick. The persistent kicks of a child against the back of her seat on the plane annoyed Mary.

sense.name: a force, a jolt of energy
sense.examples: The missile accelerated with a kick. John felt the kick of the rifle as it discharged its bullet. The kick of the engine almost unseated Bob when he revved up the motorcycle.

sense.name: a sudden physiological stimulation
sense.examples: That double espresso really gave me a kick. The junkie felt the familiar kick of the heroin coursing through his veins. The margaritas tasted smooth but had a powerful kick.

sense.name: an emotional pleasure or thrill
sense.examples: It was a kick for him to see his oldest grandson competing in the tennis tournament. Those kids are doing these crimes just for kicks. John gets his kicks snowboarding.

sense.name: a widespread interest, a fad
sense.examples: Mary is always trying the latest dieting kick. He never really got into the jogging kick.

sense.name: a gripe or complaint
sense.examples: He called the front desk with some kick about the air conditioner not working. What's her kick anyway - she should be happy with these results.

sense.name: rhythmical thrusting of the legs in a swim stroke
sense.examples: The instructor taught the children a basic kick in the swimming pool. The coach has helped her improve the efficiency of her side kick.
